questionListItems.title: Can I apply for Migrant Domestic Worker (FDW) Levy Concession for more than one maid?

answer.body: The FDW Levy Concession is applicable for one FDW per care recipient. However, each household can apply for the concession for up to 2 FDWs for 2 care recipients at any one time.

questionListItems.title: Where can I get the application form for the Migrant Domestic Worker (MDW) Levy Concession?

answer.body:
Login to AIC’s eService portal (eFASS) with your SingPass.


a. On the overview page, look for the “Apply to Receive Scheme(s) Payout” section and select “For myself” or “As a caregiver”.


We recommend that you nominate the care recipient’s bank account to receive the payout.



We strongly encourage you to apply online as there is a shorter waiting time for application approval. If you are unable to submit your application using the eFASS, please email us at apply@aic.sg, or walk in to any of our AIC Links to request for a hardcopy application form.


b. Should the care recipient lack mental capacity, please go through the Additional Guidance.

questionListItems.title: How long does it take for the HCG/ FDW Levy Concession (PWD)/ IDAPE/ PioneerDAS to be approved

answer.body: We will inform you of the outcome of your application within three weeks from the date of receipt of the completed application. If your application is incomplete, we may take a longer time to process your application as we may need to contact you for more information. Thereafter, a letter will be mailed out to inform you of the outcome.

The Caregivers Training Grant is a $200 annual subsidy that lets caregivers attend approved courses to better care for their loved ones. The $200 subsidy is provided for each care recipient every financial year (from April to March the following year). If multiple caregivers of the same care recipient wish to attend training, the $200 would need to be shared among the family members. 


The list of courses available under the Caregivers Training Grant can be found on the Caregiver Training Courses e-calendar. The trainer could conduct the class in your home, or in a classroom at a training centre. You can also use a computer or other electronic devices to learn, by watching videos and reading training materials. 


You must pay at least $10 after registering.

How to Apply

1. Choose a course from the e-calendar.

Visit the calendar here.

2. Contact the training provider to find out more about the course. 

Their details are available in the calendar.  

3. Register for the course 

Tell the trainer you want to apply for CTG at least two weeks before the course starts. Your trainer will give you the application form to fill out, and will submit the CTG application form for you. 


You may also download the CTG application form.


Please click here for more information on the Caregivers Training Grant.

questionListItems.title: If there is a change in the care recipient, will I still get the Migrant Domestic Worker Grant (FDWG)?

answer.body: Note: The Home Caregiving Grant replaces the Migrant Domestic Worker (FDW) Grant from October 2019. Click here to learn more about the Home Caregiving Grant.

questionListItems.title: Can I change the nominated bank account for Home Caregiving Grant (HCG)/ PioneerDAS/ IDAPE?

answer.body:
You can login with your SingPass on eFASS and navigate to “Manage My Schemes” > “Change in Scheme Details”.


If you are changing the nominated bank account on behalf of a care recipient who lacks mental capacity, you will need to submit a Mental Incapacity Certification if you have not done so before. Please refer to Additional Guidance for more information.

Do keep a copy of the application documents for your own reference.

questionListItems.title: What is the Pioneer generation das?

answer.body:
The Pioneer Generation Disability Assistance Scheme (PioneerDAS) is part of the Pioneer Generation Package, which honours what Singapore's Pioneers have done for the country. Under this scheme, Pioneers who have disabilities can receive $100 a month, which they can use for expenses.


Please click here for more information on PioneerDAS.

questionListItems.title: Who is eligible for the Pioneer Generation Disability Assistance Scheme (PioneerDAS)?

answer.body:
Eligibility

The applicant must be a Pioneer

Singapore citizen born on or before 31 December 1949; aged 65 and above in 2014 and

Obtained citizenship on or before 31 December 1986.

Always requires some assistance with at least 3 Activities of Daily Livings (ADLs).


Please click here for more information on PioneerDAS.

questionListItems.title: How can I apply for the Pioneer Generation Disability Assistance Scheme (PioneerDAS)?

answer.body:
Login to AIC’s eService portal (eFASS) with your SingPass.


a. On the overview page, look for the “Apply to Receive Scheme(s) Payout” section and select “For myself” or “As a caregiver”.

We recommend that you nominate the care recipient’s bank account to receive the payout.

Refer to this guide if you need more information on how to proceed with your application on eFASS.


We strongly encourage you to apply online as there is a shorter waiting time for application approval. If you are unable to submit your application using the eFASS, please email us at apply@aic.sg, or walk in to any of our AIC Links to request for a hardcopy application form.


b. If the care recipient is residing in a nursing home, you may nominate the nursing home to receive the payout, which can be used to offset the nursing home bills. Please approach the nursing home for assistance.


c. Should the care recipient lack mental capacity, please go through the Additional Guidance.


You may click here for more information on PioneerDAS.

questionListItems.title: If my parent is a Pioneer living overseas, can he/she apply for PioneerDAS?

answer.body:
One of the eligibility criteria for the PioneerDAS scheme is that the Pioneer must be living in Singapore to qualify for the scheme.


Please click here for more information on PioneerDAS.

Introduction to the Interim Disability Assistance Programme for the Elderly


The Interim Disability Assistance Programme for the Elderly (IDAPE) is an assistance scheme that was set up in 2002 for a small group of seniors who were not eligible for ElderShield at the time, because they were too old or had pre-existing disabilities.


If these seniors develop severe disabilities, they can receive $150 or $250 monthly cash payout (depending on their financial circumstances) for up to 72 months. There is no restriction on how the payments should be used, as long as they are used for the care of the disabled IDAPE claimant.


For example, the payments can offset:


  • Medical bills

  • Nursing costs

  • Hiring a Migrant domestic worker (MDW) as a helper to care for the disabled IDAPE claimant

The senior may nominate himself/herself, a caregiver who is 21 years old and above, or a nursing home that the senior is residing in to receive the IDAPE payout.


Please click here for more information on IDAPE.

questionListItems.title: Who is eligible for the Interim Disability Assistance Programme For the Elderly (IDAPE)?

answer.body:
1. Care recipient is a Singapore citizen and living in Singapore.

2. Care recipient must be:

  • Born on or before 30 September 1932; or

  • Born between 1 October 1932 and 30 September 1962 (both dates inclusive), with pre-existing disabilities as of 30 September 2002.

3. Care recipient is unable to perform at least three Activities of Daily Living(ADLs), as certified by an IDAPE-appointed assessor.

4. Household Means Test


Please click here for more information on IDAPE.

questionListItems.title: How can I apply for the Interim Disability Assistance Programme For the Elderly (IDAPE)?

answer.body:
Login to AIC’s eService portal (eFASS) with your SingPass.


a. On the overview page, look for the “Apply to Receive Scheme(s) Payout” section and select “For myself” or “As a caregiver”.


We recommend that you nominate the care recipient’s bank account to receive the payout.


We strongly encourage you to apply online as there is a shorter waiting time for application approval. If you are unable to submit your application using the eFASS, please email us at apply@aic.sg, or walk in to any of our AIC Links to request for a hardcopy application form.


b. Should the care recipient lack mental capacity, please go through the Additional Guidance.


The care recipient will also have to visit an IDAPE-appointed assessor to assess the disability condition.


1. Contact an MOH-accredited severe disability assessor to undergo a disability assessment.


a. Click here for the list of assessors.


b. The assessor will conduct the disability assessment and collect an assessment fee from you. If the care recipient is assessed to be severely disabled, the full assessment fee will be reimbursed to you with the first payout.


The fees are as follows, if:

You visit an assessor's Clinic: $100

An assessor visits your house: $250


c. If the care recipient is residing in a nursing home, the nursing home can help submit a Resident’s Assessment Form (RAF) in place of the severe disability assessment. Please approach the nursing home for assistance.

You may click here for more information on IDAPE.

questionListItems.title: What should I do if I missed the Interim Disability Assistance Programme For the Elderly (IDAPE)?

answer.body:
If you missed the Interim Disability Assistance Programme For the Elderly (IDAPE), you will need to submit the following:


  • A new AIC Scheme Application Form

  • Have a valid Household Means Test

  • Visit an IDAPE Assessor for assessment

questionListItems.title: What is the Caregiver Training Grant (CTG)?

answer.body:
The grant is a $200 annual subsidy that lets caregivers (family members and Migrant domestic workers) attend approved courses to better care for their loved ones. The said subsidy is provided for each care recipient every financial year (Apr - Mar the following year). A minimum co-payment of $10 is required for each course.


Please click here for more information on the Caregivers Training Grant (CTG).
